alert.note: Alert for Inland Taylor; Lafayette (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 15 at 3:29PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Lafayette and east central Taylor Counties through 400 PM EDT... At 329 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles east of Perry, moving south at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Pinland, Foley, Townsend, Athena, Fenholloway and Smith. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
